summary: This module tests standard integral types in sendmail, particularly verifying that LONGLONG_T and ULONGLONG_T are properly configured and behave as expected for type conversions and overflow/underflow operations.

logs.reason: Indicates the start of the test suite for standard integral types

logs.message_template:
Your C compiler appears to support a 64 bit integral type,
but libsm is not configured to use it.  You will need to set
either SM_CONF_LONGLONG or SM_CONF_QUAD_T to 1.  See libsm/README
for more details.
logs.reason: Warns that the system supports 64-bit types but libsm is not configured to use them
logs.resolution: Update configuration by setting SM_CONF_LONGLONG or SM_CONF_QUAD_T to 1 as directed in libsm/README

logs.message_template:
Your C compiler maybe issued a warning during compilation,
please IGNORE the compiler warning!.
logs.reason: Notifies that compiler warnings during compilation should be ignored
logs.resolution: Informational message, no resolution required; the warnings are expected and can be ignored

logs.reason: Indicates that the representation of LLONG_MIN does not match expectations in hexadecimal format
logs.resolution: This could indicate a compiler or platform-specific issue with 64-bit integer representation. Review compiler settings and platform documentation for long long integer support.

logs.reason: Indicates that the representation of LLONG_MAX does not match expectations in hexadecimal format
logs.resolution: This could indicate a compiler or platform-specific issue with 64-bit integer representation. Review compiler settings and platform documentation for long long integer support.
